document.masterDocTitle: Buestanmyia chiriboga gen. nov. et sp. nov. (Diptera: Tabanidae: Diachlorini) from the Ecuadorian Andes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Buestanmyia chiriboga gen. nov. et sp. nov. (Diptera: Tabanidae: Diachlorini) from the Ecuadorian Andes

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality:
Ecuador , Pichincha Province ,
27 km Quito-Chiriboga
to San Juan ,
3200 m
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Holotype female of
Buestanmyia chiriboga
gen. nov. et sp. nov. a. Habitus in lateral view (scale bar = 3.0 mm); b. Head in frontal view; c. Head in lateral view; d. Antennae (scale bar = 0.5 mm); e. Maxillary palpus (scale bar = 0.5 mm); f. Wing (scale bar = 3.0 mm); g. cerci (cerc), hypogynium (hypo), and genital fork (gen fork) (scale bar = 0.4 mm).

FIGURE 2. Paratype male of
Buestanmyia chiriboga
gen. nov. et sp. nov. a. Habitus in lateral view (scale bar = 3.0 mm); b. Habitus in dorsal view (scale bar = 3.0); c. Head in frontal view; d. Head in lateral view; e. Antennae (scale bar = 0.5 mm); f. Maxillary palpus (scale bar = 0.5 mm); g. Wing (scale bar = 3.0 mm); h. cerci (cerc), hypogynium (hypo), and genital fork (gen fork) (scale bar = 0.4 mm).

TABLE 1. Morphological differences between genera of Diachlorini from Neotropical and Andean Regions and
Buestanmyia
gen. nov.

A g e l a n i u s Rondani
B o l b o d i m y i a Bigot
D a s y b a s i s Macquart
Q u e r b e t i a Fairchild
M y i o t a b a n u s Lutz

tr.td: M e d i u m -s i z e d (10.0 – 14.0 mm)
M e d i u m - s i z e d (9.0–14.0 mm)
M e d i u m - sized (14.0 mm)
Q u a d r a n g u l a r, without dorsal projection
Small and rounded with a long dorsal projection
G r e a t l y inflated
With anterior half black or yellowish
Hyaline or with small black spots
G o n z á l e z

tr.td: F a i r c h i l d

bibRefCitation.author: Burger, J. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Burger, J. F. (1996) Description of the male and variation in Bolbodimyia galindoi Fairchild (Diptera: Tabanidae), and revised key to species of Bolbodimyia. Proceedings of the Entomological Society of Washington, 98 (3), 390 - 395.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. This species is known only from the type locality in the western Andes of Ecuador .

Type material.
Holotype ♀ (QCAZ), ECUADOR , Pichincha Province ,
27 km Quito
– Chiriboga to San Juan ,
3200 m
,
16.06.1977
, W. Schacht
.
Paratype ♂ (UMCE): Pichincha Province : same as holotype
.
Etymology. The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the type locality.
